node.title: The pursuit of wisdom
node.description: Does older really mean wiser? Wisdom may be gained with age but, researchers say, you have to pursue it – and it can represent a freedom and creativity unknown to our younger selves.

node.title: Jim Gaffigan on the perils of aging gracefully
node.description: The comedian discusses his less-than-graceful attainment of years, and its effects on his knees.

node.title: 'It's un-Australian': Bob Katter refused entry to pub
node.description: Queensland federal MP Bob Katter failed to provide proof of his COVID vaccination status, but says more allowances need to be made for people without modern phones.

node.title: At 73, Billy Crystal is just warming up
node.description: The youthful comedian has often enjoyed playing old, but it will be less of a stretch for the now-73-year-old to play an aging comic in the upcoming Broadway musical, "Mr. Saturday Night."

node.title: Cryonics: Putting your future plans for life on ice
node.description: In an Arizona facility, the bodies of nearly 200 people, and 90 pets, are being stored in liquid nitrogen at -320°F, to be kept frozen until scientists of the future can possibly revive them.

node.title: ‘Insecure’ Recap, Season 5, Episode 6: Dreams and Ghosts
node.description: This week’s episode revolves largely around professional aspirations and the messy entanglements that can result from them.

node.title: Matthew McConaughey Says He Will Not Run for Texas Governor ‘at This Moment’
node.description: With about two weeks before the candidate filing deadline for the Texas primary, the actor said a run for office is “a path that I’m choosing not to take at this moment.”

node.title: Melbourne cafe owner afraid to go to work after death threat left at vandalised store
node.description: A Melbourne cafe owner is left with a hefty damage bill after vandals break a window at his cafe, leaving behind a threatening note singling out the state government's COVID regulations.

node.title: Windang siege accused allegedly fired WWII rifle into home before taking hostages
node.description: The 40-year-old's lawyer did not apply for bail and it was formally refused. Police allege they found child abuse material and multiple weapons at the man's home.

node.title: Covid-19: 182 new community cases as traffic light decision due
node.description: The Ministry of Health says Capital & Coast DHB have achieved 90 percent double vaccination, becoming the second DHB to achieve it after Auckland.

node.title: Candice Bergen: One of a kind
node.description: Born to Hollywood royalty, the five-time Emmy-winning actress, model and photojournalist found her greatest talent in comedy, and at 75 is finding new wellsprings of confidence, as well as the privilege of being a doting grandmother.

node.title: Living to 100: One island's remarkable record of centenarians
node.description: Tucked in the mountains of the Italian island of Sardinia is the village of Villagrande, where researchers are studying one of the highest concentrations of centenarians in the world.

node.title: Can we reset our biological clocks?
node.description: Life expectancy has increased in recent decades, but researchers are looking for ways to further slow the aging process and extend human life, including warding off disease by targeting the biology of aging itself.

node.title: ‘Succession’ Season 3, Episode 7: Citizen Ken
node.description: Ken tries to have it both ways with a birthday party that is both absurdly over the top but disownably ironic. Unfortunately for him, it is more tragedy than farce.

node.title: Both parties claim victory as Honduras awaits election results.
node.description: By Anatoly Kurmanaev

node.title: FOI documents reveal Australia's Future Fund invests $150m in companies linked to Myanmar military
node.description: Myanmar's civilian government in exile has criticised Australia's sovereign wealth fund for investing in several companies — including weapons manufacturers — that have done business with Myanmar's military.

node.title: Access to landmark blocked in bid to prevent virus spreading
node.description: The Kohere whānau, which owns the land that gives access to the East Cape Lighthouse, say the closure will allow East Coast residents time to be vaccinated against Covid-19.

node.title: A woman is charged with arson in quarantine hotel fire in Australia.
node.description: A 31-year-old mother and her two children had arrived in Queensland a few days ago.

node.title: Here's what you need to know about Hanukkah 2021
node.description: From lighting candles to eating jelly donuts: Here is how the eight-day celebration of the Festival of Lights unfolds.

node.title: Do the vaccines protect against the Omicron COVID-19 variant?
node.description: Do the Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca vaccines protect against the new variant? The short answer is probably. But we'll know for certain "within days".

node.title: NZ sharemarket opens lower in wake of Omicron variant
node.description: Local financial markets have opened sharply lower in reaction to the emergence of the Omicron coronavirus strain as close as Australia.

node.title: Carbon footprints in the spotlight at tourism industry summit
node.description: The tourism industry is being challenged to lead the fight to reduce carbon emissions as part of a major new initiative.

node.title: Border protections will 'buy us time' as Omicron spreads - scientist
node.description: A leading scientist is warning New Zealand needs to keep a close eye on the border as the Covid-19 Omicron variant spreads around the world. Audio

node.title: West Auckland shooting: Man dead after opening fire on three police officers
node.description: A man has been shot dead after injuring three officers when he opened fire on them this morning, police say.

node.title: First North American Omicron Cases Detected in Canada Among People Who Visited Nigeria
node.description: "Two individuals in Ottawa tested positive for the COVID-19 Omicron variant with recent travel from Nigeria," said the government of Ontario on Sunday.

node.title: Bipartisan Pair of Senators Stress Importance of Booster Shots as Threat of Omicron Looms
node.description: Senators Amy Klobuchar and Bill Cassidy joined U.S. health officials on Sunday to push booster shots as more countries reported their first cases of the Omicron variant.

node.title: WA watching Omicron very carefully before declaring reopening date, Premier says
node.description: Mark McGowan says it is still his plan to declare in the first half of December a date for the state to open up, but authorities will watch what happens with the new Omicron variant of COVID-19 carefully over the next week.

node.title: How may the LNP's embrace of net zero affect its electoral chances in Queensland's coal country?
node.description: The so-called "coal seats" of central and north Queensland recorded strong swings away from Labor in 2019, but Scott Morrison's adoption of a net zero plan has reset the electoral battleground.

node.title: Sydney man arrested over historical sexual assaults after DNA breakthrough
node.description: A 51-year-old man is arrested over a series of sexual assaults which occurred in Sydney more than 15 years ago after police re-opened their investigation and made a DNA match.

node.title: Wine tariffs are crushing Australia's most lucrative market
node.description: China's tariffs on Australian wine imports have wiped almost a billion dollars from the trade, and the industry is bracing for more pain heading into the 2022 vintage.
